title: First parameterized path component stripped from logs
body:
## Bug Report

### Version

<!--
List the versions of all `axum` crates you are using. The easiest way to get

`cargo tree | grep axum`
-->
axum v0.3.0 (https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum.git?rev=9b17d86b92006d39e6c97acb80206c4e010c3f91#9b17d86b)

### Platform

<!---
Output of `uname -a` (UNIX), or version and 32 or 64-bit (Windows)
-->
Darwin 20.6.0 Darwin Kernel Version 20.6.0: Mon Aug 30 06:12:21 PDT 2021; root:xnu-7195.141.6~3/RELEASE_X86_64 x86_64

### Description

When having multiple nested and parameterized routes, the logging output seems to swallow the first parameterized path component.

A trimmed version of my router looks as follows:
```rust
Router::new()
    .nest(
        "/:user",
        Router::new()
            .nest(
                "/:repo",
                Router::new()
                    .route(
                        "/settings",
                        get(handlers::repo::settings).post(handlers::repo::settings_post),
                    )
                    .route("/", get(handlers::repo::index)),
            )
        .route(
            "/settings",
            get(handlers::user::settings).post(handlers::user::settings_post),
        )
        .route("/", get(handlers::user::index)),
    )
    .route("/login", get(handlers::login))
    .route("/", get(handlers::index))
```

If I go to the following routes, the logs outputs:
- `/user1/repo1/settings` -> `/repo1/settings`
- `/user1/settings` -> `/settings`
- `/user1` -> `/`
- `/login` -> `/login`
- `/` -> `/`

So interestingly only the very first parameter `:user` is stripped and if there are more parameters like `:repo` they show up in the logs.

Only parameters seem to be affected, if I go to `/login` it shows properly in the logs.
